description: A major late Iron Age and Roman religious complex overlooking the River Severn. Cult figures and curse tablets indicate that the primary deity worshipped here was Mercury.
bibliography: Cleary, S., (2015), The â€˜end of the gods' in late Roman Britain

Smith, A., (2008), The Fate of Pagan Temples in South-East Britain, in Ritual Landsacpes of South-East Britain
Woodward, Leach, (1993), The Uley Shrines: Excavation of a Ritual Complex on West Hill, Uley, Gloucestershire, English Heritage, available at: http://dx.doi.org/10.5284/1028203
